item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, November 19, 2024 at 9:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Llama 3.1 405B now runs at 969 tokens/s on Cerebras Inference (328 points | 108 comments)
2. DOJ will push Google to sell off Chrome (484 points | 506 comments)
3. It's hard to stop Math Acceleration once you start (19 points | 2 comments)
4. Launch HN: Regatta Storage (YC F24) – Turn S3 into a local-like, POSIX cloud FS (424 points | 234 comments)
5. Maslow 4: Large format CNC routing made accessible (113 points | 27 comments)
6. $8k Suzuki from India received a 5-star crash test rating (131 points | 94 comments)
7. Building Observability with ClickHouse (20 points | 3 comments)
8. Show HN: FastGraphRAG – Better RAG using good old PageRank (305 points | 77 comments)
9. 20 years of Google Scholar (278 points | 133 comments)
10. Batched reward model inference and Best-of-N sampling (9 points | discuss)
11. Sequin: A powerful little tool for inspecting ANSI escape sequences (53 points | 9 comments)
12. Hyperfine: A command-line benchmarking tool (114 points | 12 comments)
13. New textbook teaches students about matrix methods and their real world apps (34 points | 8 comments)
14. MailCatcher runs a super simple SMTP server (223 points | 69 comments)
15. PyTorch 101: Understanding Graphs, Automatic Differentiation and Autograd (19 points | 1 comment)
16. Hyrumtoken: A Go package to encrypt pagination tokens (50 points | 21 comments)
17. Two undersea cables in Baltic Sea disrupted (252 points | 468 comments)
18. Rats Learned to Drive–and They Love It (164 points | 70 comments)
19. Scientific American's departing editor and the politicization of science (91 points | 96 comments)
20. Museum of Bad Art (167 points | 122 comments)
21. A BBC navigation bar component broke depending on the external monitor (248 points | 104 comments)
22. Show HN: Dumbo – Hono inspired framework for PHP (50 points | 42 comments)
23. Air traffic failure caused by two locations 3600nm apart sharing 3-letter code (214 points | 219 comments)
24. Iumenta: A generic framework for animal digital twins (12 points | 3 comments)
25. Retro beige PC case goes from April Fools' joke to retail (67 points | 22 comments)
26. The Skyline algorithm for packing 2D rectangles (181 points | 44 comments)
27. The tragedy of running an old Node project (104 points | 127 comments)
28. Show HN: Tips.io – A Tailwind playground with AI, page management, and theming (240 points | 57 comments)
29. The Cosmos Teams with Complex Organic Molecules (7 points | 1 comment)
30. Histogramming Bytes with Positional Popcount (35 points | discuss)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, November 19, 2024 at 9:15 AM UTC
